intro: Dianthus jacupicensis, commonly known as the alpine campion, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, often at high altitudes. The plant features showy pink or red flowers with five petals, and its leaves are usually narrow and hairy. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family, which includes other flowering plants such as carnations and pinks. Dianthus jacupicensis is adapted to cold climates and is often found in alpine meadows and scree slopes.
